definition[0]: to make a building safe by locking the doors, especially at night
example[0]: I’ll leave you to lock up.
example[1]: Don’t forget to lock up the warehouse.
definition[1]: to put something in a safe place and lock the door, lid etc
definition[3]: if your money is locked up, you have put it into a business, investment etc and cannot easily move it or use it
definition[4]: a small prison where a criminal can be kept for a short time
definition[5]: a garage that you can rent to keep cars, goods etc in
definition[6]: to invest money or keep it in such a way that it not available to be used
example[3]: Mutual funds are an appropriate vehicle for income-seeking investors who don’t want to lock their money up.
definition[7]: an agreement by which money is invested in such a way that it cannot be used for a period of time
definition[8]: a period of time during which money is invested in such a way that it cannot be used
